description.raw:
While investigating issue #268, I noticed that `gztopic hz` incurs a substantial performance hit by subscribing to debug topics that require message serialization by the publisher. The command `gztopic bw` does not incur this performance hit, since it subscribes to the regular topic, so I changed `gztopic hz` to do the same.

To test this, open `gazebo sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` and `gztopic hz /gazebo/default/physics/contacts > /dev/null` in a separate terminal. Without this patch, you will see real-time factor cut about in half. `gztopic echo` will still reduce the real-time factor until #268 is resolved.
description.html:

The command gztopic bw does not incur this performance hit, since it subscribes to the regular topic, so I changed gztopic hz to do the same.

To test this, open gazebo sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world and gztopic hz /gazebo/default/physics/contacts > /dev/null in a separate terminal. Without this patch, you will see real-time factor cut about in half. gztopic echo will still reduce the real-time factor until #268 is resolved.

title.raw: Reduce gazebo performance lag when running gztopic hz
title.html: Reduce gazebo performance lag when running gztopic hz
